dtliExcerpt: Bryan Cranston delivers a towering performance as Lyndon B. Johnson in 'All the Way,' capturing both the crude ambition and surprising vulnerability of the 36th president.
bwwExcerpt: The Johnson who emerges at the Neil Simon Theatre is ferocious and vulgar, likely to grab you by your throat and toss off a disgusting joke or throw around four-letter words. In Bryan Cranston's hands, he's completely irascible - and one of the highlights of the Broadway season... Cranston, fresh of...
